title: Factoring $$x^2+bx+c$$
text: When factoring trinomials of the form $$x^2+bx+c$$, we get an answer $$\left(x+k\right) \left(x+h\right)$$, where k and $$h$$ sum to $$b$$ and multiply to c
speech: When factoring trinomials of the form ; x squared plus b x plus; c , we get an answer ; open paren x plus k, close paren; times, open paren x plus h, close paren; , where k and  h  sum to  b;  and multiply to c

title: Factoring the Equation with the Given Rules
text: To factor into the form $$\left(x+h\right) \left(x+k\right)$$, we could take $$k=-5$$ and $$h=1$$, because they sum to $$b=-4$$ and multiply to $$c=-5$$ We have $$\left(x-5\right) \left(x+1\right)$$
speech: To factor into the form ; open paren x plus h, close paren; times, open paren x plus k, close paren; , we could take  k; is equal to, negative 5  and  h, is equal to 1 , because they sum to  b, is equal to, negative 4  and multiply to  c, is equal to; negative 5  We have ; open paren x minus 5, close paren; times, open paren x plus 1, close paren;
